snippet.textDisplay: It's incredible to me that as soon as the second installment in the series, Samus could already be taking on the iconic look that's still used today.
snippet.textOriginal: It's incredible to me that as soon as the second installment in the series, Samus could already be taking on the iconic look that's still used today.

snippet.textDisplay: This game scared me to bits.
snippet.textOriginal: This game scared me to bits.

snippet.textDisplay: I liked that the world was NOT varied -- the planet isn't trying to entertain you, it just IS.  When you get lost, you feel like you really ARE lost in miles of caverns.  I had to be an expert map-maker, but it's not like Samus was going to find a map terminal from which to download.
snippet.textOriginal: I liked that the world was NOT varied -- the planet isn't trying to entertain you, it just IS.  When you get lost, you feel like you really ARE lost in miles of caverns.  I had to be an expert map-maker, but it's not like Samus was going to find a map terminal from which to download.

snippet.textDisplay: +Zack C Etrian Metroid
snippet.textOriginal: +Zack C Etrian Metroid

snippet.textDisplay: Probably the only great tune in the entire game.
snippet.textOriginal: Probably the only great tune in the entire game.

snippet.textDisplay: Not my favorite metroid, but a great song.
snippet.textOriginal: Not my favorite metroid, but a great song.

snippet.textDisplay: Very underrated game. I occasionally return to it just to make sure I can still beat it in less than two hours.
snippet.textOriginal: Very underrated game. I occasionally return to it just to make sure I can still beat it in less than two hours.

snippet.textDisplay: +roundthewheelrtw Speaking of beating this game, HOW DO YOU BEAT THE FINAL BOSS!? I think I'm getting close to killing it and then BAM! All of my health gone. I just can't survive long enough to kill it. Any strategies?
snippet.textOriginal: +roundthewheelrtw Speaking of beating this game, HOW DO YOU BEAT THE FINAL BOSS!? I think I'm getting close to killing it and then BAM! All of my health gone. I just can't survive long enough to kill it. Any strategies?

snippet.textDisplay: Bought this game with some birthday money at Sears (yeah, surprisingly, they had a video game section).  Loved the SR388 music in between the different areas.  Helped make Samus one of my favorite characters (plus second main in SSB).
snippet.textOriginal: Bought this game with some birthday money at Sears (yeah, surprisingly, they had a video game section).  Loved the SR388 music in between the different areas.  Helped make Samus one of my favorite characters (plus second main in SSB).

snippet.textDisplay: This is actually my favorite song of the entire series.
snippet.textOriginal: This is actually my favorite song of the entire series.

snippet.textDisplay: One of the few Gameboy songs that constantly stays in my playlists.
snippet.textOriginal: One of the few Gameboy songs that constantly stays in my playlists.

snippet.textDisplay: As monotonous as this game was...I still had a good time playing it for some reason.
snippet.textOriginal: As monotonous as this game was...I still had a good time playing it for some reason.

snippet.textDisplay: little brother played through this game, but could never beat the harder metroids,  would always have me do it.  An interesting time then.
snippet.textOriginal: little brother played through this game, but could never beat the harder metroids,  would always have me do it.  An interesting time then.

snippet.textDisplay: say what you will about 2 but this song fucking rules
snippet.textOriginal: say what you will about 2 but this song fucking rules

snippet.textDisplay: This game also suffered from the lack of a map feature, which made things difficult in terms of remembering where lava had previously been.
snippet.textOriginal: This game also suffered from the lack of a map feature, which made things difficult in terms of remembering where lava had previously been.

snippet.textDisplay:
@thinfriedtofu
Nah, a map was really needed. Playing with one greatly enhanced the gameplay. Makes the game enjoyable.
snippet.textOriginal:
@thinfriedtofu
Nah, a map was really needed. Playing with one greatly enhanced the gameplay. Makes the game enjoyable.

snippet.textDisplay: @thinfriedtofu Did the map detract from super Metroid in your opinion? And I don't see why it'd be impractical.
snippet.textOriginal: @thinfriedtofu Did the map detract from super Metroid in your opinion? And I don't see why it'd be impractical.

snippet.textDisplay:
suffered from? nah. having a map really detracts from the whole "on an alien planet all by yourself wandering around" atmosphere.
Plus a map would be impractical to even create due to the non-Euclidean room layout of Metroid II.
snippet.textOriginal:
suffered from? nah. having a map really detracts from the whole "on an alien planet all by yourself wandering around" atmosphere.
Plus a map would be impractical to even create due to the non-Euclidean room layout of Metroid II.

snippet.textDisplay: I agree that Metroid 2 didn't have as good music overall as the other games in the series, but IMO Metroid 2 had probably the best atmosphere in whole series thanks to very ambient sounds in the background and dark scenery.
snippet.textOriginal: I agree that Metroid 2 didn't have as good music overall as the other games in the series, but IMO Metroid 2 had probably the best atmosphere in whole series thanks to very ambient sounds in the background and dark scenery.

snippet.textDisplay: This has me getting nostalgic, and I never even played the game.
snippet.textOriginal: This has me getting nostalgic, and I never even played the game.

snippet.textDisplay: Good game.
snippet.textOriginal: Good game.

snippet.textDisplay: This game had some pretty big faults like camera being too zoomed in, the controls feeling too floaty and the environments not being varied enough, but there's no denying that it introduced a lot of elements that we now all associate with the series. The graphics were also very impressive for the handheld. As for the music, it was very disappointing after the awesome chiptunes we got in Metroid, except for this catchy exploring theme. I think this game could really beneficiate from a remake like Zero Mission.
snippet.textOriginal: This game had some pretty big faults like camera being too zoomed in, the controls feeling too floaty and the environments not being varied enough, but there's no denying that it introduced a lot of elements that we now all associate with the series. The graphics were also very impressive for the handheld. As for the music, it was very disappointing after the awesome chiptunes we got in Metroid, except for this catchy exploring theme. I think this game could really beneficiate from a remake like Zero Mission.

snippet.textDisplay: Remake Completed!! Samus Returns. I thought it was pretty good too.
snippet.textOriginal: Remake Completed!! Samus Returns. I thought it was pretty good too.

snippet.textDisplay:
@Parnifia the Bastard Unlike the first one, there is always an acid pit that won't go lower until you killed all metroids around, so you can't get that much lost. When you get the spider ball, it's a matter of exploring every wall you find. While you climb, also bomb away.

I actually beat this game without a FAQ, but it was hard to find out sometimes where to go, specially at the end parts, but that's metroid for ya.
snippet.textOriginal:
@Parnifia the Bastard Unlike the first one, there is always an acid pit that won't go lower until you killed all metroids around, so you can't get that much lost. When you get the spider ball, it's a matter of exploring every wall you find. While you climb, also bomb away.

I actually beat this game without a FAQ, but it was hard to find out sometimes where to go, specially at the end parts, but that's metroid for ya.

snippet.textDisplay:
Also, the layout was freakin' confounding. I just bought it on VC for the 3DS, and I'm completely lost after the Spider Ball.

*_IT'S NO USE!_*
